name: NYC’s Iconic SummerStage Returns With Over 70 Free Performances Across The Five Boroughs
description: Is your beach chair nearby? TheCapital One City Parks Foundation SummerStagelineup for 2025 has arrived, and you’ll want a free seat to the festivities, which run fromMaytoOctober. For its 39th iteration, thissummertradition is emphasizing diversity and genre-defying artists across the spectrum: hip-hop, salsa, indie rock, dance, and beyond. When it comes tofree concerts, this celebration certainly takes the cake. Yes, typically the schedule of SummerStage performances are free, but there are benefit concerts thrown into the schedule as well.

name: Pier 17’s Electrifying Summer Rooftop Concert Series Kicks Off This May With Over 60 Shows
description: If you ask us, singing and dancing along to live music in New York City is the perfect way to spend a night. Now, play thatlive musicon top of a rooftop and pair it with warm weather and unparalleled skyline views and, well, that night literally couldn’t get any better. If we’ve piqued your interest you’re in luck–theexhilarating Rooftop at Pier 17 2025 Concert Series is back for the seasonand it’s bringing with it all of the above! A highlight of the momentous South Street Seaport in Downtown Manhattan, the 300,000-square-footPier 17is the port’s signature venue. Eachspringandsummertimethey dedicate their 3,500-capacity, open-air rooftop to an epic concert series, and their2025 season will officially kick off on Thursday, May 1st.

name: Streets Across All Five Boroughs Will Ban Car Traffic For Earth Day
description: Earth Dayis approaching (Tuesday, April 22nd), and with it a time to reflect on what wonders Mother Nature provides and how best we can take care of this beautiful planet. Lucky for New Yorkers, the city has thrown an annualCar-Free Earth Dayevent for the past nine years, and this year will be no different! Earth Day is a global phenomenon kickstarted by activism in the 1960s and 1970s. The first official Earth Day even led to the creation of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). Millions of Americans gathered in protest at the first Earth Day in 1970, and the celebratory day has continuously grown and evolved for climate change advocacy.

description: At long last,springhas arrived, and thefirst cherry blossoms of the seasonare making an appearance in NYC. NYC isfinallydefrosting after thePolar Vortex. name: ‘Mamma Mia’ Makes Its Return To Broadway Just In Time For Summer
description: Here we go again:Mamma Miais on its way back to Broadway this summer, and we certainly can’t resist her. Needless to say, the iconicBroadway show— the ninth longest-running of all time — is beloved for the quirky storyline and celebration ofABBAmusic. Mamma Miafocuses on a young woman on the eve of her wedding as she tries to uncover her father’s true identity. This quest sends three fellas from her mother’s past back to the island they all visited many moons ago, and of course, a whirlwind ensues. The beloved tale has made its way from the stage to screen, but it’s clear fans can’t resist its original format.

name: Zoë Kravitz Spills Her Favorite Things To Do & Places To Eat In NYC
description: Zoë Kravitz’s ability to radiate cool girl energy is effortless, and our desperate desire to recreate it for ourselves is a never-ending feat. So when she spills on the places she likes to frequent in New York City there’s only one thing we’re going to do: give her our undivided attention. In a recentinterviewwith Elle regarding the 2024 release of her directorial debut,Blink Twice,Kravitz unveiled some of her favorite things you can find her doing and places you can find her eating around the city. Kravitz has been living in NYC for two decades–she was raised between Los Angeles, where her mom lived, and NYC andMiamiwhere her dad lived after her parents’ split. Sorry, though, toour friends over in LA–Kravitz may like NYC better (but who doesn’t?

Andthe Candlelight seriesis combiningbeautiful blossomswithmoving melodiesand thousands ofcandlesfor intimate concerts to pull music lovers out of their winter slumber. Candlelight concerts are all about creating anidyllic atmosphere. Spring is in itself the perfect atmosphere.

name: Experience Holland’s Breathtaking Tulip Fields Only 75 Minutes From NYC
description: Holland Ridge Farms, located about anhour and ten minutes from NYCin Cream Ridge, New Jersey, brings that tulip magic to the tri-state area. The farm was started by the Jansen family, whose patriarch immigrated to the U. S. from Holland in 1964. He learned how to grow tulip bulbs properly from his own father, and brought that knowledge right to NJ.

name: The Jazz Age Lawn Party & Picnic Marks The Start Of Summer and Tickets Are On Sale
description: For years, the annualJazz Age Lawn Partyhas attracted all walks of life in NYC! So slip on your pearls and adjust that bow tie as you meet up for thistime-traveling festivalonJune 14-15andAugust 9-10! The Jazz Age Lawn party is now returning in this summer for its20th edition, bringing two-weekends worth of fun, music and food to NYC. Come summertime, like a seasonal migration, thousands of peopletake the ferry over to Governor’s Islandto party like it’s the roaring 20s! This nostalgic and notable experience will allow you to dress up in extravagant outfits and attend this decadent party.

name: One Of NYC’s Most Underrated Historic Treasures Lies In Brooklyn
description: If you ask us,St. Ann & the Holy Trinity Churchin NYC should be on the top of every things-to-do-in-Brooklyn list. Thanks to its extraordinaryvaulted ceiling,stained glass windowsby William Jay Bolton, and Gothic details, it’s an utterly striking building. And there’s even more beauty in its history. Its roots trace back to 1778, and its Episcopal congregation is one of the oldest of its kind in the US.

name: Say “Hello” To A Spectacular Candlelight Concert Celebrating Adele In NYC
description: Adele may have finished her “Weekends With Adele” residency, butrumor has itthat the Candlelight concert series is bringing a captivatingtribute to Adele to NYC. The British singer-songwriter boasts16 Grammysandmillions of album sales, continuing to inspire female artists and shape the music industry. Adele is no stranger to New York, having performed at Radio City Music Hall in 2015 and the Madison Square Garden the following year.

name: 6 Ways To Celebrate Native American Heritage Month In NYC
description: November is Native American Heritage Month, also commonly referred to as American Indian and Alaska Native Heritage Month, wasconceived in 1990. During this month we celebrate the rich and diverse cultures, traditions, and histories of Native people while also acknowledging their important contributions to the establishment and growth of the U. S. This month is also seen as a time to educate the public and raise awareness of Native peoples and the challenges they’ve faced throughout the years. From honoring this month through traditional singing and dance, to educating yourself on the history of Native peoples through educational readings, here are different ways to celebrate and honor this month throughout NYC.

name: This Brooklyn House May Have The Best Halloween Decorations In All Of NYC
description: Located at the corner of Albemarle Road and Argyle Roadhe, this Victorian Queen Anne-style house is adorned with what seems to behundredsofHalloween decorations. Skeletons climb the exterior of the house, spider webs cover the lawn, and ghosts greet you on the porch. Gravestones peek out from the bushes as butchered body parts hang from the porch roof. And it’s long been a favorite spooky spot for New Yorkers! The enormous wrap-around porch is decorated with eerie portraits of haunted clowns, as spine-chilling statues including witches, goblins, reapers, and skeletons guard the perimeter.

description: You might think NYC has already mastered the art ofobservation decks, and truly how much higher can we go? Well, according to Rockefeller Center, to a maximum of900 feet! The Top of the Rock Observation Deck on the 70th floor is giving New Yorkers with a head for heightsthree extra storiesto stare over our beautiful city on the brand new Skylift. Skylift at Top of the Rock Observation Deck boasts an unobstructed, 360-degree aerial view of NYC. Tickets can now be purchased (for $35 + Top of the Rock ticket) even though the official opening date is onOctober 1, 2024.

name: The Great Jack O’Lantern Blaze Returns To Tri-State Area For 20th Year Anniversary
description: Withfall now in full swing, andHalloweenon the horizon, it’s time to start getting into the spooky mood by a paying a visit toThe Great Jack O’Lantern Blaze! The annual tradition is one of our favoritefall getaways(whether it be to the Hudson Valley or Long Island) to stroll theone-of-a-kind pumpkin trail featuring 7,000 illuminated gourdslike you’ve never seen before. For everything you need to know about this awesome Tri-State attraction, see below, and start bookmarking a date for this! The Great Jack O’Lantern Blazeis a spectacular Halloween walking trail that featuresover 7,000 hand-carved, illuminated pumpkinsassorted into installations. This event transforms the historic landscapes of Van Cortlandt Manor and Old Bethpage Village into amesmerizing display of glowing sculptures, including dinosaurs, trains, and even a pumpkin ferris wheel.

name: National Parks Are FREE On This Special Day — Visit These 5 Spots Near NYC
description: If you’re looking to escape New York City this fall, why not visit one our country’s beautiful national parks? The National Park Service is offeringfree admission to all the national parksonSeptember 28thto honor National Public Lands Day (NPLD). Celebrated annually every fourth Saturday of September, National Environmental Education Foundation puts on NPLD to celebrate the largest-single day volunteer effort for public lands in the nation. It’s an opportunity to appreciate, honor and conserve our public lands. Last NPLD, volunteers contributed 41,500 hours of service.

name: Toronto-Based Garage-Turned-Bathouse Opens In NYC With One Of The Largest Saunas In North America
description: What started as a steamy escape in a Toronto garage during the pandemic eventually went on to become asocial shvitz, attracting a cult following,and it recently made its New York City debut. Othership, one of Canada’s most frequentedbathhouses, has officially found a home in Flatiron. Othership began in the midst of the Covid pandemic when founder Robbie Bent’s three-car garage-turned-sauna, ice bath, and tea lounge began to attract the interest of others. Bent and his four co-founders eventually expanded the concept into a Toronto-based brick and mortar in 2022, with a second location opening late 2023. And as of this past July they’ve added an NYC location to their roster!

It will be at Citi Field fromSeptember 28 –October 13 at Broadway Commons.

Capital One City Parks Foundation SummerStage is an annual festival thatspotlights emerging artists across all genresthroughfree performances across all five boroughsof NYC. name: Here’s Everything You Need To Know About The Astoria Park Carnival
description: Summeris just around the corner and there’s no better activity than grabbing cotton candy and spending all your change on carnival games at one ofNYC’s many fests! One particular favorite of ours is the Astoria Park Carnival that’s returning this June. Here’s everything you need to know about the 2024 Astoria Park Carnival. The Astoria Park Carnival is an annual festival in Queens complete with rides, games and fair food. The 2024 Astoria Park Carnival is fromWednesday, June 5th to Sunday, June 9th.

name: Brooklyn Navy Yard: Ultimate Guide for First-Time Visitors
description: TheBrooklyn Navy Yardin New York has come a long way since its establishment in 1801. Once a bustlingshipyard for the US Navythat lived through both World Wars, it went on to witness the filming of critically acclaimed movies likeJohn Wick, Joker, and Spider-Man 3. The historic yard,sprawled across 300+ acres,is currently a hub of industrial and innovative activities and among the most intriguing places to visit in the Big Apple. From exploring its historic naval hospital tomesmerizing views of the Manhattan skyline, there’s plenty to do when visiting the Brooklyn Navy Yard. Background on the Brooklyn Navy Yard The US Navy actively used the yard from the early 1800s to the 1960s tomanufacture many important marine giants, such as steel ships and battleships.

name: The National Puerto Rican Day Parade Is Returning This Weekend
description: TheNational Puerto Rican Day Parade (NPRDP)is an essential summer event inJune in NYC, The beloved parade is returning yet again for 2024 set to take place along Fifth Ave on Sunday, June 9. This year’s theme isBoricua de Corazón(Puerto Rican at heart) and is dedicated to the municipality of San Germán, Puerto Rico and Hawaii’s Puerto Rican community. Find everything else you need to know about the time-honored tradition below. The National Puerto Rican Day Parade is a NYC celebration that honors Puerto Rican heritage and culture, plus the renowned achievements of Puerto Rican individuals with music, dance and themed floats. This year’s parade also celebratesits 67th anniversary, as the founders first marched in New York City in 1958.

name: Thousands Of Toy Elephants Will Fall From NYC Skies Tomorrow
description: Forget about it raining cats and dogs, it’ll be raining elephants tomorrow atNYC’s sixth annual Dumbo Drop! The quirky tradition, that releases thousands of toy elephants from rooftops over Washington Street in Brooklyn will return to DUMBO tomorrow,Friday, May 31, 2024. Every year a different artist designs the elephants’ parachute. This year’s selected designer isNoah Lyon. This year’s Dumbo Drop will be split into two different times:5 pm and 7 pm.

name: This UFO Fair 2 Hours From NYC Shines A Spotlight On The Town’s Alien History
description: Feeling extraterrestrial? New York’s town of Pine Bush will be the coolest place in the galaxythis summeras the annualPine Bush UFO Fair is set to make its returnthis Juneon Saturday, June 1st. Now in its 13th year, the fair allows visitors to step into the cosmos ascosplay characters and extra-terrestrials of all shapes and sizestake over the town’s Main Street. Beyond the unidentified other-worldly beings, the fair will also have games and activities and vendors selling food and unique and eclectic craft vendors selling, of course,UFO-themed novelties. Visitors are encouraged to attend in costumeif they are comfortable doing so!

description: For years, the annual“]Jazz Age Lawn Partyhas attracted all walks of life in NYC! So slip on your pearls and adjust that bow tie as you meet up for thistime-traveling festival soononJune 8th – 9thandAugust 10th – 11th! The Jazz Age Lawn party is now returning in June for its 19th edition, bringing“]two-weekends worth of nostalgiato NYC. Come summertime, like a seasonal migration, thousands of peopletake the ferry over to Governor’s Islandto party like it’s 1920! Starting at 11am, this nostalgic and notable experience will transport you to a time period in American history with such a substantial societal and economic change.

description: Edge recently announced they’d be bringing back their popular Sky High Yoga to provide incredible yoga classes on thevery top of the city. Butthis summer they’re offering way more than just that! Beyond yoga, Edge just announced they’re now adding an array of new programming includingEquinox signature classes,pilates, athletic conditioning, cardio dance, and cardio kickboxing classesled by expert Equinox instructors to their weekly fitness lineup. The new classes will be added to the schedule beginning Friday, June 7th. Tickets will go on saleThursday, May 30 at noon for $90.

name: Here’s Where To Play Pickleball In NYC Right Now
description: Last summer’s craze is now a full blown sensation here in NYC, andpickleball has taken over the sports scene here in the city! After the smashing success ofWollman Rink’s pickleball court in Central Park last summer, new courts have popped up all around NYC, making it accessible as ever to play the emerging sport! Whether you’re a beginner looking to get your toes wet or a full on player, here’swhere to play pickleball in NYC right now! Returning for another year, Wollman Rink in Central Park has been transformed into 14 pickleball courts for the summer! It’sthe largest pickleball installation in the entire Northeast, and it’s open seven days a week from 8 am – 9 pm, from now through early fall.

description: Coney Island’sLuna Park officially reopened for the season in March. However, the park will debut its brand new Go-Kart attraction this Friday, May 24th. Called Electric Eden Raceway, adrenaline junkies will get to driveNYC’s very first electric-poweredGo–Karts! It’s name hails from Luna Park’s original nickname, “Electric Eden,” due to all of the park’s impressive lights. Through the racetrack’s video mapping gamification, drivers will be locked in for an epic experience from the starting point to the finish line.

description: Juneis almost here, and with it comesPride Monthand the chance tocelebrate and show our support for the LGBTQIA+ community! name: You Can Pick Your Own Sunflowers At This Farm In NJ
description: For those looking topick their own fresh sunflowers, Happy Day Farm in New Jersey is a must-visit, and even if you decide not to take any home (though, whywouldn’tyou? ) the sight of a sunflower field alone is worth the visit. They officially open for sunflower season onJuly 3rd, 2024and will remain open for picking through August 25th, 2024. Sunflowers tend to bloom between the middle of summer through early autumn. And we can’t wait to see ayellow wonderlandat the farm in a few months!

name: Here’s A Complete Guide To Fleet Week NYC 2024
description: One thing that always lets us know thatsummerfun is on its way in NYC is theannual NYC Fleet Week. During the week, multiple ships and thousands of sea service members are set to visit the five boroughs offering everything from public ship visitations to a variety of military demonstrations. Learn all the information you need to know aboutthis year’s Fleet Week below! First held in 1982, NYC Fleet Week is aweek-long celebrationthat invites participants from all around the world to enjoy various events held tohonor the US Navy, Marine Corps, and Coast Guard. During the week, plenty ofships from the US Navy, Coast Guard, and sometimes ships from foreign navies visit New York City and dock in various locations around the city’s waterfront.

name: Free Kayaking Will Return To Brooklyn Bridge Park For The Summer
description: The city’s summer water activities have officially commenced. Brooklyn Bridge Park Boathouseis bringing their kayaks out for visitors to enjoy the simple pleasure of kayaking, for free, with breathtaking views of the skyline. Weather permitting, the boathouse will offer free sessions from Pier 2 onWednesdays, Thursdays, & Saturdays starting May 29th through the end of September. You don’t need any prior kayaking experience to take one out for a spin on the water, but they do recommend wearing water-friendly clothes as your feet and seat may get a bit wet. There will also be a safety boater on the water if you need any assistance (they’ll be in a red vest).

name: Here’s Where To Get Free Solar Eclipse Glasses In NYC
description: It’s now only a few days until thetotal solar eclipsewill cover New York skies in utter darkness! Though total solar eclipses are rarer than general solar eclipses, what makes this upcoming event absolutely unmissable is the fact that total solar eclipses only occur in the same placeevery 366 years, according toForbes. Still unsure what asolar eclipsemeans? According to theNational Weather Service, a solar eclipse occurs when the moon is sandwiched in passing between the sun and earth. The total solar eclipse happens when the moon completely blocks the sun’s light from earth, creating a shadow trail that is known as the path of totality.

name: NYers Can Get Free Citi Bike Rides This April For Earth Day
description: This year we’ll celebrate Earth Day on Monday, April 22nd, and there’stons going on around the cityto encourage New Yorkers to be more environmentally conscious and to live in harmony with our planet! And this year Citi Bike is celebrating by offeringfree unlimited 30-minute rides to New Yorkers! The promotion is taking place in partnership with the Department of Transportation’s53-block Open Streets: Car-Free Earth Day event, which will take place between 10 am and 4 pm onSaturday, April 20th. Through the support of Lyft, Citi Bike will offer free unlimited 30-minute rides on a classic Citi Bike. All riders may take advantage of the offer by using thepromo code CARFREE24in the Citi Bike app.

name: A Complete Guide To Celebrating Kwanzaa 2023 In NYC
description: Holiday season is in full swing, and while you’re finishing up the last things on yourholiday bucket list, it’s important we highlight Kwanzaa and how NYC is celebrating this year! Particularly in Harlem and other Caribbean neighborhoods around the city, we’ve put together a guide about the holiday and what’s going on around NYC! Kwanzaa is a an annual holiday that celebrates African-American culture, unity, and heritage. Devised in 1966, this holiday honors African social values and typically consists of large feasts, gatherings, gift exchanging, and more! Kwanzaa this year begins on on December 26 and goes until January 1, 2024.

name: 5 Best Places To Catch The Changing Fall Foliage In New York State
description: Theannual fall foliage reportfor the area is updated every week throughout the season indicating where and when to visit, so be sure to take advantage and schedule a weekend trip before winter officially begins. Whether you’re a native New Yorker or are just visiting, taking a drive outside of the five boroughs toenjoy apple pickingor to bask in the beauty of the autumn leaves is well worth it. And based on the fall foliage report, the autumn color foliage is beginning to change and peak in upstate NY! While some of these locations are way further than others (basically in Canada) we promise, the beauty is worthy of the drive. So although we can fight all day aboutwhere “upstate” really begins, at the end of the day what we really mean here is anything above Westchester County.

name: A Rift To Stranger Things’ Upside Down Will Open Across The ESB Tonight
description: Hey nerds, besides heading to Hawkins atNYC’s epic Stranger Things experiencefor a bitchin’ adventure, the city will honor the upcoming season in a thrilling new way tonight! On Friday, May 27, the saga’s fourth season will hit Netflix. In order to honor the mind-bending show,Netflix will open “rifts” to the Upside Down across landmarks worldwide on Thursday night, May 26, reportsIGN. Tons of cryptic messages across social media led up to Netflix’s exclusive announcement with IGN hinting to today’s visual spectacle. View this post on Instagram The rift will “gradually emerge on the southern facade of the Empire State Building”starting at 8:30 pm ET on Thursday, featuring iconic moments from prior seasons, and sneak peeks at season 4’s storylines.

name: Lincoln Center’s Bright Rainbow Steps Are Back For Pride Month
description: June isPride Month, a historic time to celebrate and advocate for the LGBTQ+ community. Two years ago, Lincoln Center lit up in Pride colors with incredible light displays for the first time in its history, and they’ve been continuing the tradition since. This year, the steps of the iconic Josie Robertson Plaza are once again rainbow, paving the way to NYC’s largest andbrand new outdoor dance floor! You’ll also see the symbolic Pride flag flying high in the sky. They will also have special LGBTQ+ programming June 21-24, including an “ULTRA PRIDE!

name: Uncover The Secrets Of NYC’s Iconic Grand Central Terminal On This Exciting Tour
description: Better understand the history of our magical city on this incrediblewalking tour of the mysteries hidden in NYC’s largest transportation hub. In the early 1900s, NYC Railroad noticed that the original Grand Central Depot was unfit for the progressive 20th century. As a result, they held a design competition to determine which company would be responsible for revamping the landmark we know it as today. Architecture firm Reed & Stem won the competition, but that wasn’t enough to satisfy the railroad and their hopes for the new terminal. To ensure that it was asgrandas they’d intended, an additional architect firm, Warren & Wetmore, was hired to collaborate with Reed & Stem as “Associated Architects.

name: The Empire State Building Will Shine Red For ‘Heartbeat Of America’ Every Night Through COVID-19 Battle
description: The building managers just shared that they have a new plan for lighting up the tower every evening, one that pays respects to the entire country as well as all of the medical workers fighting coronavirus every single day. “We’ll never stop shining for you,” they wroteon social media. “Starting tonight [March 30] through the COVID-19 battle, our signature white lights will be replaced by theheartbeat of Americawith awhite and red siren in the mastfor heroic emergency workers on the front line of the fight. ” This is in addition to the brand music-to-light show that takes place every night at 9pm, synched to “Empire State of Mind. ” They synch it withZ100 and iHeartRadio.

name: Gov. Cuomo & Brother Arguing On Live TV Over Who’s The Favorite Child Is Big NY Energy
description: The Italian New York energy is palpable in this brotherly duel the world was able to witness live on CNN last night. Their on-air quarrel got particularly heated after reporter Chris Cuomo says he doesn’t believe in rules and tells his brother “there’s always time to call mom, she wants to hear from you. ” Governor Cuomo did not take these back-to-back jabs lightly and immediately snaps back that he actuallyhascalled Mom, while brother Chris quickly butts in to say “that’s not what she said. ” Chris goes as far as to say that the Governor “has blown the credibility of the entire interview” by “lying to [his] audience” about who their mother’s favorite child is. If you missed the hilarious moment on Monday night, you can watch it all play out in the clip below: two cuomos on live tv arguing which cuomo was the more loved cuomo is making me laughhttps://t.

name: NYC Now Has A Roller Disco Brunch Party Straight Out Of An 80s Dream
description: The Roller Disco Brunch Partywill be popping up at different venues across the city (with the first few being at Brooklyn’s well-known Schimanski! ) with an 80s-themed experience that’ll bring together the best of roller skating, retro disco, food and drinks. These epic skate parties are so much more than just your typical Sunday brunch where you sit around with friends eating and drinking. Here you’ll be able to also hit the dance floor on skates and have some old-school fun with plenty of of live entertainment, special performances by professional roller dancers, a DJ, and (of course) brunching. Oh, and for those looking to go all out…dressing in the 80s-theme is encouraged (although not required).

name: These Have Been Some Of NYC’s Biggest Changes Over The Past Decade
description: Thinking about the last 10 years in NYC brings to mind so many different news headlines, social media trends, and simply the memories of everyday life. But no matter what year, we can all acknowledge what an amazing city New York truly is! As we come to the end of the 2010s and prepare for the start of the 2020s, here are some of the biggest changes NYC has seen in the past decade: From substantial additions to the city’s skyline to the rapid development of certain neighborhoods, we’ve definitely seenmanychanges to the very streets of NY over the past decade. Statistics show that city constructionhas hit another record high(according to the number of building permits), and shows no signs of slowing down. In fact, the New York Building Congress reported that spending on construction projects will likely increase by another 10 percent by the end of the year, according to theNew York Daily News.

Which is to say, it’s time to do some exploring! If you’re looking for plans during this magical time of year, here’s a list ofthe best things to see and do in NYC this spring! You can spend a beautiful day walking around NYC taking totally Instagrammable pictures with the pink and white blooms. Althoughpredictions are pointing towards a later mid-April bloom, we can still expect a city of full beautiful colors this spring.

name: Here’s How To Spend 48 Hours In New York City
description: …only joking, you’ll getsomerest. For those looking to experience NYC to the fullest, you’ve come to the right place. Our team here at Secret NYC has put together an itinerary of all the places you can’t leave without seeing. Our guide takes you to some local spots in addition to all the tourist must-do’s. You’ll definitely want to bring comfortable shoes because this is a pedestrian city—which means there will bea lotof walking.

name: 15 Fabulous Things To Do In New York City This November
description: What says Christmas in New York City better than the Nutcracker ballet? Production companies all across the city are putting on their own renditions of the show so you don’t have to break the bank to score tickets to the one at Lincoln Square (although we do recommend going at least once, it’s an experience). These three optionsare worth experiencing this year as well. If you’ve ever been interested in street art, this is your chance to learn about the techniques, theories and history of the practice. Atthis hour long class, take the can to the wall and make your very own mark on NYC.

name: Find The Golden Snitch At This Harry Potter Themed Scavenger Hunt
description: Think you have what it takes to catch the golden snitch? With thepurchase of your ticket, you will gain access to the coolest themed scavenger hunt New York City has to offer. OnSunday, March 25th,you will have the chance totest your wizarding skillswith a series of physical and mental challenges that will separate the wizards from the muggles. Although there won’t be butterbeer, the winners get an amazing NYC gift package! Whether you’re Gryffindor or Slytherin,come out to prove you’re New York’s biggest Harry Potter fan.

Which is to say, it’s time to do some exploring! If you’re looking for plans during this magical time of year, here’s a list ofthe best things to see and do in NYC this spring! You can spend a beautiful day walking around NYC taking totally Instagrammable pictures with the pink and white blooms. Althoughpredictions are pointing towards a later mid-April bloom, we can still expect a city of full beautiful colors this spring.

name: Would You Attend This Ghostly Brooklyn Seance?
description: Mentalist Jason Susan has performed in venues such as SoHo House and Carnegie Hall. Now, he’s demonstrating his skills to the masses with a Victorian-era inspired seance. When you purchase your ticket you’ll be given the Williamsburg address to the apartment where your journey will unfold. During that time, 13 people will form a circle as Suran takes you to The Other Side. The Victorian-era seances are known for being more of a performance of mind-reading than a true connection to the spirits beyond.

name: 12 Bizarre Fears Only New Yorkers Understand
description: There’s plenty to fear when you step out of your apartment in the morning and hit the streets. Will you run into a pack of unfriendly rats? What about those pigeons? Will you fall into a floor cellar on your walk to work? Or potentially be kicked in the face by an undesired performer if you decide to take the subway?

name: You’ll never be as cool as Apollo, the NYC Terrier …Here’s why
description: A while back we posted the video bellow, it shows a dog in shades and sneakers strolling around a subway train like he owns the place. Our caption read, “You’ll never be as cool as this dog spotted on a train in Queens! ” …and judging by your reaction, we were right. Now we know more about the classy canine, and we’re here to share. His name is Apollo and he lives in Queens.

name: 7 Events In May You’ll Definitely Want To Add To Your NYC Bucket List
description: Welcome to May, NYC! There’s lot’s to look forward to this month, from big dates like Cinco de Mayo, Starwars day (yes, it’s a big date, deal with it) and Mothers Day on the 14th, to National Hamburger Day on the 28th. Here we’re not getting into specifics, we’re just offering up 7 events that will get you warmed up for one of the most action-packed months on the calendar. Enjoy: A short time from now, at a venue not far away, a group of rebel burlesque stars twirls and entertains a whole galaxy. Ladies and gents, this titillating sci-fi adventure is the hottest and most entertaining show from Tatooine to Brooklyn.

name: These Maps Show Exactly Where The Most Car Accidents Happen In NYC
description: If you’ve ever driven in New York you’ve seen that it wavers in between gridlock and Mad Max. The maps below show where the most dangerous accidents happen in NYC. Telling a New Yorker the streets of NYC are dangerous for drivers and pedestrians is like telling the Pope about Jesus. We all already get it, but maybe not exactly how deadly our roads can be. So catastrophic is the toll of our deadly roads, In 2014, Mayor de Blasio launched hisVision Zero campaign, an initiative designed to drastically reduce the number of fatalities caused by traffic in NYC.

Which is to say, it’s time to do some exploring! If you’re looking for plans during this magical time of year, here’s a list ofthe best things to see and do in NYC this spring! You can spend a beautiful day walking around NYC taking totally Instagrammable pictures with the pink and white blooms. Althoughpredictions are pointing towards a later mid-April bloom, we can still expect a city of full beautiful colors this spring.
